turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi there. Good morning!

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hi. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Nice to meet you. Hello.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello. I, I'm Doctor <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi. Um, so, before we start your appointment, could I confirm your full name and date of birth, if that's OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah. Uh, Mary Richards. Uh, and my, I'm forty years old. So.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You're <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> OK, fine. So, you're <UNIN/> you're forty years old, you said, yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Perfect, OK. Um, are you in a private place where you're OK to speak at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, great. Um, so how can I help you today?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so, just been having some, um, problems with my hearing, I can't really hear very well, and <UNSURE>my</UNSURE> , noticed that my face has been feeling a bit numb recently.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. OK. And how long has this been going on for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's been, it's been a few weeks now. Um, been about three weeks or something.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. And, is this just on one side, or both sides?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Just one side, just on my left side, I've noticed that the hearing's kind of gone down a bit.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. And <UNIN/> your face feeling numb, where exactly is that? Which part of your face? Can you, can you show me with your finger?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so again it's the left side, it's kind of like around my left ear, and kind of, along here. So like, my jawline's just all feeling a bit numb round here.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. OK. Um, has anything else happened, um, in this time? Any other symptoms you have at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not that I, <UNSURE>not that</UNSURE> I've noticed, <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think, occasionally noticed <UNSURE>a</UNSURE>, ringing in my ear. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Some, some ringing in your ear. OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, <UNSURE>yeah it's</UNSURE> <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK. Um, and um, have you had any weakness or numbness, down the, in the rest of the body at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no, no, no, nothing like that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Have you had any difficulty swallowing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, have you had any difficulty speaking?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have you noticed any problems with your vision, at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, that's all good.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, and do you have the numbness present right now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah. It kind of, kind of, there quite often, <UNSURE>so, all the</UNSURE> time. So yeah, right now it feels very, doesn't feel like when I touch <UNSURE>this</UNSURE> side of my <UNSURE>face</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. Sure, OK. Alright, um, just going back to the kind of <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> feeling in, in the ear, um, do you have any discharge coming from that ear at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, nothing, nothing coming out.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: K. Any pain in the ear, or from the ear?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, <UNSURE>don't think</UNSURE> so.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. And um, have you had any fever at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, nothing like that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, do you, um, have any itchiness in the ear?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Do you use cotton <UNIN/> buds to kind of clean your ears out?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Pardon? Ohh, no, no, no, don't use cottons buds, <UNIN/> like that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No. Alright. OK. Alright. Um, <UNIN/> need to, need to ask a few other general questions. Um, do you have any other illnesses at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I've, well I've got kind of, been told I have polyps in my nose in the past and, occasionally get them kind of <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, that, that's all fine and, you know I take a <UNSURE>Rennie's</UNSURE> if I need to, and if my nose polyps are playing up I've got a spray. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Other than that I think they said, ages ago, I had something called, can't quite remember but, labyrinthitis, something like that, but again, nothing, nothing <UNSURE>ongoing</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. Sure, OK. So, are you on any regular medication? You mentioned the spray for your nose.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so, no, uh, I only take the, spray for my nose when I need it for, and um, sometimes take <UNIN/> like Rennies, but I just get that from the chemist.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. <UNIN/> and, and the spray for your nose, where do you get that from? Is that from a doctor?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, they gave me a prescription ages ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. Do you remember the name of the spray, at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Unfortunately I don't, sorry.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> that's alright. That's alright. Uh, and you're not on any other medication at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Do you have any <UNIN/>, any allergies to any medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no just <UNSURE>Latex</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Latex, OK. Alright, that's good to know. Um, and um, in terms of your family, are there any kind of illnesses within your family at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: My brother had, Neurofibromatosis, I think it is. Um, other than that everyone else is OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, good. That's good. Um, and in, in terms of your own kind of background now, are you, are you working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so I'm a, I'm a jockey, um, but, because of all the kind of, these symptoms I've been getting, especially sometimes when I get a ringing, I can feel a bit dizzy. <UNSURE>Ohh</UNSURE>, I've just had to do far less training.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So, kind of beginning to, yeah, impacting work, um, a little bit now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So you have to excuse my ignorance, you mean, jockey like with horses? Is that what you're talking about? Yeah. Alright, OK. Fine. Um, great. Um, uh, and, uh, do you live alone?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I, uh, live with my partner.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, OK. Right, um, do you have any pets at all at home?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no pets.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fine. OK so, alright. Um, Is there anything else that you wanted to tell me about what's been <UNIN/> going on, recently?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, just like, like I said, like the ringing um, occasionally and, when I get that I can sometimes feel a bit dizzy but, the main thing is really the, lack of hearing, and the numbness that's got me <UNIN/> like,  yeah, no idea what's going on there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fine. Alright. Um,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, what I think <UNIN/>, go on.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I <UNSURE>mean</UNSURE>, there was just like, there was one thing I think <UNSURE>just</UNSURE>, 'cause I can panic and you can look online, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> get a bit, frantic.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, I guess what I'm trying to think is, you know, is there something particularly serious <UNSURE>that</UNSURE>, you know, will need to be sorted and.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Obviously, really, anything can just make you really frantic <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Hopefully nothing <UNIN/>, so serious I will die from it, I don't know I just, I think <UNSURE>got myself</UNSURE> in a pickle.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNIN/> so um, uh, obviously we're limited in terms of assessment via the video, uh, portal.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> um, from what you've told me, this doesn't seem to be you know, anything um, that you're gonna die from. However, I would like you to be assessed in a clinic today.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK? I <UNIN/>,would like you to come to one of my clinics. I would like a GP to assess you. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> what you're, what you're describing might be something called Bell's Palsy. OK? Um,

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We can go into that, explaining what that is, if um, if that's confirmed on, on physical examination. But um, that's not usually a <UNIN/> life-threatening problem.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But, um, part of the reason why I'd like you to come in, it's just that we can do a, a what we call a, a neurological examination just to make sure there's nothing else going on, and confirm <UNIN/> that might be the diagnosis. Have a look, have a look inside the ear, see if there's any, <UNIN/>, anything to see within the ear.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, um, um, so, in answer to your question. No, I don't think that you need to worry about that, I <UNIN/>,  think you know <UNIN/>, preliminarily I can, I can reassure you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: However, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, in order to definitively reassure you, I, I think you need a physical examination today, OK. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, so what I wanna do, is I'm gonna send a message to our admin team, I'll ask them, to book you in for a face-to-face appointment in one of our clinics.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, <UNSURE>that's</UNSURE> fine.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, within Central London. OK, and then you can ring the <UNIN/>, the support team number, I'll leave that number in your notes. And you can ring them after five minutes, and then they'll slot you in to a place that's convenient for you, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, that's fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. So, someone <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> will see you, and hopefully you will be able to reassure further but, please make sure the appointment gets done today.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, yep, <UNSURE>I</UNSURE> will do, that's fine. Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right then. OK. Nice to see you. Take <UNSURE>care</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Bye bye.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Bye.
